content.description: Clip a few bolts and move left under a roof before continuing up. Be mindful to extend your runners to minimize rope drag, and because the rope can easily get snagged on flakes on the left side of the roof.
content.location: Bolted line to the left of Makayla's.

content.description: Fun crack climb, fingers to hands with an interesting jog to the right near the top, good warmup.
content.protection: Finger to hand sized gear. 2-bolt rap anchor on top.
content.location: Obvious crack on the far left end of the gold wall. Buttress rises from a small aspen grove.

content.description: Begin up face and flakes with wonderful, varied movement for 10 bolts.
content.location: Far right side of the Quaking Aspen Wall, first fully bolted route to the left of the arete which the wall technically begins on.

content.description: Climb up easy cracks and ledges to the first bolt at about the 20' mark, clip the bolt above your head and monkey left on the floating ledge, do one of the coolest pure mantels ever then get ready for the crux which is moving up past the horizontal finger crack, after that follow a few more bolts to a chimney flare feature which can be climbed a few different ways to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Five Quickdraws for the route and a few more for the top.
content.location: The first  bolted line to the right of Double Cream, Double Sugar which is the obvious steep big hands and fists crack to the right of Quaking Aspen.

content.description: Begin by climbing up three or four bolts of the route Butterfly, veer right at this point and follow an up and rightward traverse (bolts) through a final blocky bit at the top of a prominent blocky tower. Fantastic rock and varied movement await you.
content.protection: Follow the permadraws, 70 meter rope or greater MANDATORY
content.location: Left side of the Quaking Aspen Wall.  For more information, please reference the wonderful Mammoth Area Rock Climbs by Marty Lewis

content.description: The beautiful steep hand/fist crack to blocky crack terrain (but still entertaining climbing) on the left side of the Quaking Aspen Wall.
content.protection: Singles of .4 camalot and below, doubles .5-4 and an extra #3 camalot
content.location: Far left side of Quaking Aspen Wall.

content.description: Same start as Hummingbird, but head up straight and then trending left clipping bolts along the way. Â Keep going to the second anchor.
